    • Method Detail

      • SELECT_CUSTOMER

        public static java.lang.String SELECT_CUSTOMER()
        The string that represents prepared SQL statement to select customer from Customer table. SQL statement is: 
        SELECT * FROM customer
        Returns:
        String represents SQL SELECT statement.

      • SELECT_CUSTOMER

        public static java.lang.String SELECT_CUSTOMER(java.lang.String selectWhat,
                                               java.lang.String selectFrom)
        The string that represents prepared SQL statement to select customer from Customer table. SQL statement is: 
        SELECT [specified columns] FROM customer [WHERE specified scope]
        Parameters:
        selectWhat - String represents specified columns (one or more) to select. If not null - modifies current prepared SQL statement. For example: 
        SELECT ID, CUST_NAME FROM customer
        selectFrom - String represents specified scope for selecting. If not null - modifies current prepared SQL statement. For example: 
        SELECT * FROM customer WHERE ID = ?
        Returns:
        String represents SQL SELECT statement.

      • SELECT_CUSTOMER_FROM_CUSTOMER_COUPON

        public static java.lang.String SELECT_CUSTOMER_FROM_CUSTOMER_COUPON()
        The string that represents prepared SQL statement to select customer from Customer_Coupon table by customer's id. SQL statement is: 
        SELECT * FROM customer_coupon WHERE CUST_ID = ?
        where ? - is the id of selected customer.
        Returns:
        String represents SQL SELECT statement.

      • INSERT_INTO_CUSTOMER

        public static java.lang.String INSERT_INTO_CUSTOMER()
        The string that represents prepared SQL statement to insert Customer object into the customer table. SQL statement is: 
        INSERT INTO customer (CUST_NAME, PASSWORD) VALUES (?, ?)
        where first ? - is the name of current Customer object, second ? - is the password of current Customer object.
        Returns:
        String represents SQL INSERT statement.

      • INSERT_INTO_CUSTOMER_COUPON

        public static java.lang.String INSERT_INTO_CUSTOMER_COUPON()
        The string that represents prepared SQL statement to insert id of customer and its coupon into the customer_coupon table. SQL statement is: 
        INSERT INTO customer_coupon (CUST_ID, COUPON_ID) VALUES (?, ?)
        where first ? - is the id of the customer, second ? - is the id of the coupon.
        Returns:
        String represents SQL INSERT statement.

      • UPDATE_CUSTOMER

        public static java.lang.String UPDATE_CUSTOMER()
        The string that represents prepared SQL statement to apply changes to already exists customer in customer table. SQL statement is: 
        UPDATE customer SET PASSWORD = ? WHERE ID = ?
        where first ? - is the password of current customer, second ? - is the id of current customer.
        Returns:
        String represents SQL UPDATE statement.

      • DELETE_CUSTOMER

        public static java.lang.String DELETE_CUSTOMER()
        The string that represents prepared SQL statement to delete current customer from customer table by customer's id. SQL statement is: 
        DELETE FROM customer WHERE ID = ?
        where ? - is the id of current customer.
        Returns:
        String represents SQL DELETE statement.

      • DELETE_FROM_CUSTOMER_COUPON_BY_CUST

        public static java.lang.String DELETE_FROM_CUSTOMER_COUPON_BY_CUST()
        The string that represents prepared SQL statement to delete current customer and its coupon from Customer_Coupon table by customer's id. SQL statement is: 
        DELETE FROM customer_coupon WHERE CUST_ID = ?
        where ? - is the id of current customer.
        Returns:
        String represents SQL DELETE statement.

      • DELETE_FROM_CUSTOMER_COUPON_BY_COUPON

        public static java.lang.String DELETE_FROM_CUSTOMER_COUPON_BY_COUPON()
        The string that represents prepared SQL statement to delete current customer and its coupon from Customer_Coupon table by id of customer's coupon. SQL statement is: 
        DELETE FROM customer_coupon WHERE COUPON_ID = ?
        where ? - is the id of current customer.
        Returns:
        String represents SQL DELETE statement.
